section.name: Write Code!
section.p: Code contributions in its various forms are very welcome - check our list of ideas! For all code contributions, we require that you sign the Contribution License. Its easy, safe and you get to use a machine that was invented more than 160 years ago - the fax machine, patented in 1843. (of course you can also use the even older postal service, first established in China 900 BC).

subsection.name: Create patches
subsection.p: If you found a bug, you are welcome to fix it. Once you have made sure that it actually fixes the problem, send the patch to the core developer list, where one of the committers will take care of it.

subsection.name: Share your paragraph templates
subsection.p: If you have programmed a nice custom paragraph that might be useful either as an example or "as is", think about sharing it with others. You only need to provide the code and a description.

subsection.name: Share site templates
subsection.p: You might have designed a really nice site and don't mind that others take it as a starting point? Why not upload the complete site templates to magnolia.info?

subsection.name: Develop modules
subsection.p: You can develop modules. Modules are meant to extend the Magnolia core and use the Magnolia module API. You are welcome to share your modules on magnolia.info, either for free (open source modules) or as commercial modules. Simply register as a Magnolia partner and add your module to the magnolia shop - this is the easiest way to sell your Magnolia modules, and it benefits you as well as Magnolia.
